name: Hofsas House Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: Yes, there are hotel rooms in the heart of Carmel for under $100! Of course not during the summer or on a holiday, but we were here on a Monday midOctober & paid $95 for a lovely room for 2. The bed was comfortable, the room was very clean, we had the usual amenities (including real coffee mugs and wine glasses in the room), free parking, & it's within 2 blocks of restaurants (only 1 block from Hog's Breath). The only thing missing in the room was a desk. But you have to like pink as that's the color of the bathroom tile!
reviews.title: Under $100 in Carmel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Staff were really friendly and welcoming. The rooms are a bit dated in their decor but entirely comfortable, clean, and spacious. I thought the hotel offered good value. Carmel is very compact, and this hotel is only 2-3 blocks away from the main strip. I arrived with 30 minutes left to get ready for a wedding. There had been a mixup and my room wasn't ready for me, but they really bent over backwards to make sure I was able to clean up and get ready for my event. Their enthusiastic service turned what could have been a nightmare into a rescued situation. Very nice people. I would recommend this and stay here again.
reviews.title: Great service, nice vibe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for two nights while in Carmel for a wedding. Great location and quaint little room! Walking distance to some great restaurants, including Em Le's (HUGE tasty breakfasts and some mind-boggling fried french toast concoction).
reviews.title: Charming :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our bed was adorable, clean and comfy. The staff was very nice, and the water in the shower was nice and hot. The room comes with a free continental breakfast. You can sit and eat next to the fireplace in the lounge, or you can put it on a tray to enjoy in your room! (My hubby brought me breakfast in bed, which elevated it to a whole new level for me!).
reviews.title: Best for the $

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also! This hotel is pet-friendly, which is great! We'd recommend it.
reviews.title: So nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I selected this hotel based on the reviews and was very happy. Carrie was a delight to deal with and they gave me a great spacious room. I would definately stay again!
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We liked the friendly staff upon our arrival and the fact that our room already had the heater turned on for us and smelt lovely. The room has period furniture that we adore. It was also a good size for the four of us. We could walk to the local shopping strip land And felt safe walking at night. we had complimentary croissants and yoghurt for breakfast in the Cosy lounge/lobby and enjoyed the view from our room. The Internet and parking were also free. A huge bonus when traveling. The shower may be small for the larger traveller, but it was very clean and that's whAt matters.
reviews.title: Cosy, warm and cute

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi there,
reviews.title: Loved the Concierge, use their Chamber of Commerce!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Felt compelled to write as we had a great time here.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay, Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: No it is not a boutique hotel as stated on their homepage but the rooms offer plenty of space and are clean and well presented. We were in off season and dropping into the Chamber of Commerce gave us special rates and an insight into the town (tell them the Chamber referred you). I am writing this too late but the lady who was Concierge was great helping us out with our stay in Carmel. It is wonderfully located and we would definitely revisit.
reviews.title: Hofsas House is fantastic and a great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Hofsas House Hotel. Very sweet people. I loved the charm of the hotel. Felt like I was in a B&B. Room was a bit dated, but clean. Shower could have used a bit more flow, but it worked. When we arrived we were given the choice of two rooms, which was very thoughtful of the staff. The first room (our original) was nice, but a bit floral and out dated. The one we chose had been updated. Great view of Ocean and nice fireplace. Would return to this hotel again. Only complaint is on Saturday night there was no parking available until after an event was over in the community room. The hotel is a bit loud, but to be honest, it wasn't the staff or the hotel, it was the other guests! Be respectful of other guests please.
reviews.title: Sweet Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Hofsas House each time we have gone to Carmel and keep coming back. One trip we had a room that was just so-so, but otherwise we have loved the place because it's clean, friendly and a great location near town. The staff are very nice and helpful. We loved the little cottage room we stayed in on our most recent visit
reviews.title: Great little motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I love the charm of Carmel. The Hofsas House is one of them. It's located at the quiet end of town, short walk to shops and restaurants, the beach, short drive to Point Lobos, Big Sur and Monterey. We had a girlfriend weekend, Hofsas House was able to accommodate all three of us in one large family room with one king (in the main room), two queen (in another room with a door) and two full bath with our own balcony with a distant view of the ocean. The spacious room have a small kitchenette and the usual amenities.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Yes, the carpet needs replacing and it's not the Sheraton or the Hyatt. This is a family-owned business where the owner is usually on site. The room decor may not be for everyone but the beds were super comfortable and there was plenty of towels for everyone. Hofsas House staff were hospitable and helpful. It felt more like a B&B or a small boutique hotel.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast includes pastries from a local bakery, fruit, yogurt, juice and coffee. Take a tray back to your room or enjoyed it the cozy living room.
reviews.title: Could do better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I am currently sitting on a patio area outside our room having breakfast. We are a family of 2 adults and 3 children and booked a family room. The room is very large with one emperor size bed in one room and 2 king beds in the other. Each room also has a walk in wardrobe and bathroom. The main bedroom also has its own gas fire which was great last night. The location is really good as you can walk to the restaurants and shops in 2 to 3 mins and the beach is also walkable. Although it is in the centre, it is very quiet and because the rooms have European style shutters we had a good lie in this morning. We tried the heated pool last night and it was really good, not too hot, just the right temperature. We would definatly stay here again and reccomend this lovely hotel.
reviews.title: Great for a family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We actually really enjoyed our stay here, but it may have been because we were enjoying Carmel. The room was clean, and comfortable, and the staff very friendly and helpful. We just couldn't give it an extra point because:
reviews.title: Nice, clean, friendly, but some issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The corner shower was dark, and had no light or fan. The rubber gasket will need to be replaced soon since it is cracking a bit and apparently letting water leak through to the floor outside.
reviews.title: Could Have Stayed Forever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. We had to ask for more towels the first night, and were told there should have been four sets in the room. Next day, we still only had one set.
reviews.title: Average quality, noisy rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: 3. Room walls and ceiling are very thin - we heard kids, footsteps, newlyweds and pool noise. It settles down early, but you won't sleep late here.
reviews.title: Hofsas House: location, location, location with great rooms and friendly staff

description: Casual European elegance with the warmth of family hospitality, a boutique family-owned inn with 37 uniquely decorated, spacious rooms, many with ocean views in the village of Carmel-by-the-Sea. Other amenities include: continental breakfast, heated swimming pool, dry saunas, off-street parking, free wireless Internet access & some rooms dog friendly.
